headlines.description: — Dillon Brooks scored 21 points and the undermanned Memphis Grizzlies beat the Charlotte Hornets 108-93 on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Brooks helps undermanned Grizzlies beat Hornets 108-93

headlines.description: — Jeremi Grant scored 24 points and Derrick Rose added 17 as the Detroit Pistons won their first game of the season, beating the Boston Celtics 96-93 on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Grant's 24 points lead Pistons past Celtics for 1st win

headlines.description: — Luka Doncic had season highs of 27 points and 14 rebounds for his first double-double of the season to lead the Dallas Mavericks past the Miami Heat 93-83 on Friday night.
— De’Andre Hunter scored 23 points help the Atlanta Hawks to a 114-96 win over the Brooklyn Nets on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hunter, Young lead Hawks to 114-96 win over Nets

headlines.description: — Giannis Antetokounmpo had 29 points, 12 rebounds and eight assists and the Milwaukee Bucks used torrid 3-point shooting to blast the short-handed Chicago Bulls 126-96 on Friday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bucks stay hot from 3-point range in 126-96 rout of Bulls

headlines.description: — Bradley Beal had 31 points and seven assists, and the Washington Wizards beat the Minnesota Timberwolves 130-109 on Friday night without Russell Westbrook for their first win of the season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Beal leads Wizards, minus Westbrook, past Wolves for 1st win

events.name: Los Angeles Lakers at San Antonio Spurs

headlines.description: — Anthony Davis had 35 points and 11 rebounds and LeBron James added 26 points, 11 rebounds and 10 assists as the Los Angeles Lakers rallied to beat the San Antonio Spurs 109-103 on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Davis, James lead Lakers' late rally over Spurs, 109-103

headlines.description: — Chris Paul hit a clutch jumper with 7.3 seconds remaining after a successful coach's challenge on the other end and the Phoenix Suns moved to 5-1 for the first time since 2009-10 by holding off the scuffling Denver Nuggets 106-103 on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chris Paul helps Suns hold off Nuggets, improve to 5-1

headlines.description: — Mike Conley made seven 3-pointers and scored a season-high 33 points to lead the Utah Jazz to a 106-100 victory over the Los Angeles Clippers on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Conley scores 33 points, Jazz beat Clippers 106-100

events.name: Portland Trail Blazers at Golden State Warriors

headlines.description: — Damian Lillard joined Hall of Famer Clyde Drexler as the only Portland players to score 15,000 points for the franchise, finishing with 34 as the Trail Blazers spoiled Golden State's home opener with a 123-98 win over the Warriors on Friday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Damian Lillard reaches 15,000 points, Blazers beat Warriors
